title: 'Unprecedented' flooding in France is expected to last all week
subhed: With most of the country still on flood alert, a new storm system arriving from Brittany is set to impact France on Wednesday and Thursday, bringing another bout of heavy rainfall and winds.

title: Jesse Jackson, pastor and civil rights icon, dies at 84
French prosecutors intervene in defense of TotalEnergies in climate trial
byline: By Stéphane Foucart and Stéphane Mandard

title: Six suspects sought in murder probe over far-right activist's death in Lyon
subhed: The prosecutor detailed the violent incident that led to the death of young far-right activist Quentin Deranque. Meanwhile, accusations against antifascist activists have spread through far-right online networks.

title: At Navalny's grave, two years after his death in a Russian prison: 'We are not alone'
subhed: Several hundred supporters of the Kremlin's most renowned opponent gathered on Monday at the Moscow cemetery where he is buried. A new investigation confirmed the cause of his death: assassination by poisoning.

title: French music festivals to book for late winter and early spring
subhed: Electronic music, rock, chanson française, hip-hop... From Paris to Marseille, via Saint-Malo or Caen, the French festival scene offers an abundance of options sure to satisfy every musical taste.
byline: By Stéphanie Binet, Franck Colombani, Stéphane Davet, Romain Geoffroy and Pierre Gervasoni

title: Who owns second homes in France?
subhed: Owners of second homes are not a homogeneous group. They include retirees, professionals and investors, reflecting changing ways of living and challenging the organization of local communities.

title: Diplomat Anne-Claire Legendre nominated to succeed Jack Lang at Arab World Institute
byline: By Roxana Azimi and Philippe Ricard

How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhed: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: South Korea's 'comfort women' take on the US military
subhed: For decades, thousands of South Korean women were forced into prostitution for the pleasure of American soldiers, with the support of the Seoul government. They are now seeking reparations.

title: In substance, Rubio's message in Munich was the same as Vance's
subhed: While the US secretary of state struck a less aggressive tone toward Europe than the American vice president had a year earlier, the substance of the speech changed little.

title: Rejecting political violence
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
'By sacrificing American soft power, Trump is exacerbating his country's unpopularity and prompting Europeans to exercise their own'
